column4: you know whats ticking me off right now? "mount: error while guessing filesystem type; mount: you must specifiy the filesystem type"
I specify ntfs and it tells me i'm wrong :(
no fat support in the kernel?
fat is supported
use fat or vfat
-t vfat is all I can work with
-t fat doesntw ork
vfat=fat32
I know
I know
I'm having more problems with my NTFS drives
captive ntfs?
no idea. I just know its NTFS.
Im retarded at fs types
install captive ntfs to add full ntfs support to linux
captive ntfs is a wrapper that allows you to use the ntfs "driver" from win2k on linux

oh that; i've worked with that before. (Sorry, its been awhile since I've used any nix distrobution). I may just go ahead and do that; but before I do that, any idea on why mount keeps telling me that im specifying the wrong fs type? (mount -t ntfs /dev/hdd1 /mnt/bigdrive; mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock)
are you sure it's ntfs?
positive
I just want to get to my music
ubuntu kernel might not have ntfs support. It doesn't matter anyways, since the kernel only includes an RO driver
just install captive ntfs and be done with it
Its supposedly in there. I may just go get captive ntfs.
I'll be back, I'm going to go setup captive ntfs
